quotes.message: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
quotes.name: Nick Hornby

quotes.message: Uncertainty is the refuge of hope.
quotes.name: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.message: Art is man's refuge from adversity.
quotes.name: Menander

quotes.message: Obscurity is the refuge of incompetence.
quotes.name: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.message: Work is the refuge of people who have nothing better to do.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: Luck is always the last refuge of laziness and incompetence.
quotes.name: James Cash Penney

quotes.message: Writing is a refuge from unhappiness, but has its own sorrows.
quotes.name: Mason Cooley

quotes.message: Crying is the refuge of plain women, but the ruin of pretty ones.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: God is our refuge and our strength, an ever-present help in trouble.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: Public opinion is the last refuge of a politician without any opinion.
quotes.name: Mark Bonham Carter

quotes.message: We take refuge in pride, because we are afraid to tell the truth to ourselves.
quotes.name: Okakura Kakuzō

quotes.message: Look not for refuge to anyone beside yourself. Heed fast to the truth as a lamp.
quotes.name: Gautama Buddha

quotes.message: One may make their house a palace of sham, or they can make it a home, a refuge.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Books are a refuge, a sort of cloistral refuge, from the vulgarities of the actual world.
quotes.name: Walter Pater

quotes.message: Make an island of yourself, make yourself your refuge; there is no other refuge. Make truth your island, make truth your refuge; there is no other refuge.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: Nostalgia is the intimate refuge of every man and every woman in a world seemingly gone mad.
quotes.name: John Larkins

quotes.message: All the times these arms were my only refuge from the world. Perhaps not fully appreciated then, but so sweet in my memory, and now gone forever.
quotes.name: Suzanne Collins

quotes.message: Music is a place to take refuge. It's a sanctuary from mediocrity and boredom.
quotes.name: Lisa Gerrard

quotes.message: You are your own refuge There is no other You cannot save another You can only save yourself.
quotes.name: Guillaume Musso

quotes.message: The temples are a refuge from life's storms even a never-failing beacon guiding us to safety.
quotes.name: Thomas S. Monson

quotes.message: Silence is the universal refuge, the sequel to all dull discourses and all foolish acts, a balm to our every chagrin, as welcome after satiety as after disappointment.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Tolerance is our safest refuge and our fortress against the handicaps that arise from schism, factions, and the difficulties inherent in reaching mutual agreement.
quotes.name: Fethullah Gulen

quotes.message: All men have one refuge, a good friend, with whom you can weep and know that he does not smile.
quotes.name: Menander

quotes.message: Home is the first refuge from – and last defense against – the disappointments and the terrors of life.
quotes.name: Dean Koontz

quotes.message: My last refuge, my books: simple pleasures, like finding wild onions by the side of a road, or requited love.
quotes.name: Tracy Letts

quotes.message: There'll be times when the only refuge is books. Then you'll read as if you meant it, as if your life depended on it.
quotes.name: Ken Bruen

quotes.message: Science has destroyed even the refuge of the inner life.
quotes.name: Carl Jung

quotes.message: The only refuge left to us was the poet's ivory tower, which we climbed, ever higher, to isolate ourselves from the mob.
quotes.name: Gérard de Nerval

quotes.message: We can find true refuge within our own hearts and minds-right here, right now, in the midst of our moment-to-moment lives.
quotes.name: Tara Brach

quotes.message: Art is merely the refuge which the ingenious have invented, when they were supplied with food and women, to escape the tediousness of life.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: My house is my refuge, an emotional piece of architecture, not a cold piece of convenience.
quotes.name: Luis Barragan

quotes.message: Cheap is the last refuge of a product developer or marketer who is out of great ideas.
quotes.name: Seth Godin

quotes.message: Taking refuge means that you align and orient your life toward Buddha's example and toward enlightenment.
quotes.name: Reb Anderson

quotes.message: The refuge from pessimism is the good men and women at any time existing in the world, -they keep faith and happiness alive.
quotes.name: Charles Eliot Norton

quotes.message: There is no refuge from memory and remorse in this world. The spirits of our foolish deeds haunt us, with or without repentance.
quotes.name: Gilbert Parker

quotes.message: Prayer is the place of refuge for every worry, a foundation for cheerfulness, a source of constant happiness, a protection against sadness.
quotes.name: Saint John Chrysostom

quotes.message: Those who bless and serve life find a place of belonging and strength, a refuge.
quotes.name: Rachel Naomi Remen
